newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ DMO uses US$100 mln bond to refinance mark loan.
newsitem.headline: NZ DMO uses US$100 mln bond to refinance mark loan.

text.p: The New Zealand Treasury's Debt Management Office said on Wednesday its US$100 million one-year eurobond issue was a refinancing of a deutschmark loan and the proceeds had been swapped into marks.
The bond was announced overnight by lead manager Nomura, with a coupon of 4.875 percent.
"We had in our portfolio a deutschmark loan which we were able to refinance at a cheaper cost to the government," a DMO official said.
"We repaid the deutschmark loan and swapped this ($100 million) medium-term note into deutschmarks. So we've just replaced one deutschmark borrowing with another, at lower cost."
The original borrowing was a 300 million mark public bond issue at LIMEAN.
